definition[0]: the length of time that a person or animal is expected to live
definition[1]: the length of time that something is expected to continue to work, be useful etc
definition[2]: the age someone will probably live to, used by insurance companies when working out the risk of insuring them
example[0]: Sixty-year-old men who still smoke have a life expectancy of less than 12 years.
definition[3]: the average number of years that something such as an electrical product will last
